intro: Heterosamara cabrae, commonly known as the Cape fynbos, is a flowering plant native to the Western Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is protected in certain areas.
